result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian Lee Donner

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Christian Lee Donner.  Attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christian Lee Donner not in court. 
Matter scheduled on a motion filed by the State
Defendant is in custody at RCJ. Defendant's appearance is waived. 
State indicates they filed a furlough motion in case 21CF995 and bond reduction modification in case 22CM994. State indicates the Defendant requires surgery as outlined in the motion and asking the court to grant the furlough from today's date at 6:00 PM to 11/8/22 at 8:30 AM. Asking the bond in case 22CM994 is modified to a signature bond with the same conditions. 
Defense does not object. 
BTC: State's motion granted. Cash bond in case 22CM994 is modified to $100 signature bond with the same conditions.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
State's Motion For Furlough and Bail Reduction

9:17 AM Defendant Christian Lee Donner in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Christian Lee Donner.  Attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense is seeking a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense makes statements on the record. 
State does not object.
BTC: Bond is modified to $100 cash bond. Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
